Deadly violence erupts during protests in Syria's Alawite regions
subhead: Three people were killed and dozens injured in protests in the city of Homs on December 28, two days after a mosque bombing that killed eight members of the Alawite minority group, from which Bashar al-Assad hails.

title: 2025: The year Europe weakened Ukraine by abandoning the Gaza Strip
subhead: Jean-Pierre Filiu writes in his weekly column that the European Union finds itself less able to withstand Donald Trump's blows to international law in Ukraine, having itself condoned such violations in Gaza.

title: Municipal elections: Louis Sarkozy tries to make a splash in French Riviera town
subhead: The son of the former French president is running a headline-grabbing campaign in Mention, both on the ground and across social media, as he tries to make a name for himself in a city where the far right enjoys strong support.

title: Immigrants in Chile fear for their future after a far-right leader won the presidential election
subhead: José Antonio Kast, president-elect since December 14, focused his campaign on the fight against undocumented immigration. Many have urged outgoing President Gabriel Boric to regularize undocumented migrants before his term ends.

title: How dining etiquette reveals social divides among young people
subhead: Choosing a natural wine, slicing comté cheese the 'right' way, opening an oyster: For young people lacking the right social codes, embarrassment at the table is often inevitable.

title: Mariupol, Ukraine: A model city of 'new Russia'
subhead: Since 2015, photographer Gabriele Micalizzi has been documenting the Donbas region from the Russian side of the front line, an area where Moscow enforces very strict access conditions for journalists. In November, he secured permission to enter Donetsk Oblast, a region of occupied Ukraine, and traveled to Mariupol, a city destroyed by Russian forces in 2022, which has since been colonized and rebuilt in record time.
